content: What is the result of a _history query http://build.fhir.org/http.html#history --- when there are resources that are deleted? Is this behavior different when the server supports versioning?
There's an example that shows that. You'll see entry.request and entry.response that talk about the deletion.
can you give me a bit more bread-crumbs @Lloyd McKenzie ??

Hmm. I've seen it in the past, but can't find it. As well, the spec doesn't talk about the inclusion of response, but that has to be there as that's the only thing that conveys the timestamp. I've raised a tracker GF#13662

base/Patient/45 = 410 (gone) for deleted resource
base/Patient/45/_history (might = 404 if server doesn't support versioning, but will return a bundle that has the last entry as the deleted one in cases where versioning is supported)
base/Patient/45/_history/v3 = 410 (gone) for a versioned request to the deleted version
base/Patient/45/_history/v2 (will return the requested version you asked for)

This is in the spec here:
http://hl7.org/fhir/http.html#read and http://hl7.org/fhir/http.html#vread
